header.title: The Scroll of Set - February 1983
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Magical Practice

central_thesis: The document explores the core philosophy and practical mechanics of the Temple of Set, emphasizing 'Xeper' (to Become) as the central magical process for conscious evolution. It details the nature of Setian initiation, clarifies the meaning of 'Do what thou wilt' within a Setian context, and provides an in-depth account of the Wewelsburg Working as a pivotal magical act that redefines the understanding of initiation, self-consciousness, and the Order of the Trapezoid, distinguishing Setianism from other occult traditions.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Temple: Heartbeat of Setian Initiation
structure_content.summary: A biography of Priestess Marie A. Kelly III°, the new Executive Director of the Temple of Set, highlighting her personal journey into Setianism, her magical identity as Anx-Setet, and her understanding of the Temple as a 'tool' for 'true magical being through the magical art of transformation'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Crystal Tablet Mailed to all Members
structure_content.summary: An announcement regarding the distribution of the revised and expanded first book of the Jeweled Tablets of Set, the Crystal Tablet of Set, to all Temple members.

An article by James Lewis IV° discussing Aleister Crowley's Thelema, clarifying 'Do what thou wilt' as a principle of self-direction rather than mere indulgence. It positions Thelema as a valid magical concept within Setian heritage, comparing its utility to the Setian concept of Xeper and the Word of the Age of Satan.

A review of Daniel Cohen's 'Myths of the Space Age', recommending it for its skeptical approach to various occult phenomena. The review suggests it aids Setians in discerning truth from fraud within the occult subculture.
A brief quote by Victor Hugo: 'Greater than the tread of mighty armies is an idea whose time has come.'

structure_content.chapter_title: Notes from the Letters of the High Priest
structure_content.summary: A collection of administrative and philosophical notes from High Priest Dr. Michael A. Aquino VI°. Topics include the upcoming Conclave, changes in the Council of Nine (new members, term expirations), the significance and restoration of the II° degree, the status of the Ruby Tablet project, and the importance of the Scroll of Set as a forum for discussions and news within the Temple.

Michael A. Aquino's account of his visit to Wewelsburg Castle, debunking myths about Heinrich Himmler's alterations and confirming the intact state of its ritual chambers. This sets the stage for his personal magical working.

Aquino details the Wewelsburg Working (October 19, XVII, 3:00-4:30 PM, Hall of the Dead/Walhalla) aimed at understanding the Temple's June-July XVII crisis, energizing the new Working Year XVIII, and summoning 'Powers of Darkness' at the 'Mittelpunkt der Welt'. The results include new realizations, a profound understanding of 'life' as the core concept (not just self-consciousness), a critique of past initiatory efforts, and a re-envisioning of the Order of the Trapezoid's sigil and enduring principle.
A short, allegorical piece describing a journey to an 'onyx castle' to study and gain control over 'nature', reflecting themes of self-transformation and magical learning within a Setian context.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Jedi Order and the Temple of Set
structure_content.summary: An analysis comparing the Jedi Order from 'The Dark Side' with the Temple of Set, drawing parallels in their initiatory structures, types of knowledge (experience, study, initiation), and the Force/Black Magic concepts. It explores how both systems emphasize self-direction, change, and the pursuit of a 'higher self' or 'Becoming'.
A concise, poetic exhortation to 'Become as a child', embrace one's universe, control one's life, celebrate knowledge, and 'Open your senses to Set'.

A review of Terence DiStasi's 'Mal Occhio (Evil Eye): The Underside Of Vision', noting its research into folklore and metaphysical aspects of the 'evil eye'. The review suggests borrowing the book rather than buying it.
An announcement stating that Robert Brink has parted from the Temple of Set.

An announcement of the 'Registry of Dreams' (ROD) project within the Metamind Element, aiming to collect Setians' 'realer-than-real' dream/vision experiences. The project seeks to validate ESP, document supra-normal faculties, and provide historical commentary.
An invitation to Setians to participate in a project led by Robert Menschel III° to formally examine the magical uses of computers, with the goal of producing articles for the Scroll and Ruby Tablet.

key_concepts.definition: The Word of the Æon of Set, meaning 'to Become'. It signifies a process of self-creation and conscious evolution, utilizing elements of Thelema and the word of the Age of Satan and Indulgence.

Described as 'the true house of Set', 'a loving embrace from Set himself', and 'the heartbeat of Setian initiation'. It functions as a 'tool' to enable individuals, removed from the 'state of mutant beast', to achieve 'true magical being through the magical art of transformation'.

Interpreted in Setianism not as 'do what you want', but as the active pursuit and direction of one's own unique will, determining one's future path. It is considered a valid magical concept and part of Setian heritage, compatible with Xeper in its highest sense.

Referred to as the 'knowledge of Set', a core aspect of Setian understanding that emerges through initiation. It is also depicted as rays emanating from the Sigil of the Order of the Trapezoid, completing the pentagram.

A specific magical operation conducted by Michael A. Aquino at Wewelsburg Castle, aimed at understanding the crisis within the Temple of Set, energizing the new year, and summoning 'Powers of Darkness' at a recognized 'Mittelpunkt der Welt'. It led to profound insights into 'life' and the nature of initiation.

A foundational concept, re-envisioned with a complex sigil incorporating a pentagram, Black Flame rays, three 6s, and a Set-headed/tailed Tcham scepter. It is seen as the 'Earthly focus' of what it symbolizes, an enduring 'principle in the intelligent mind', existing whether or not it is a visible institution, influencing those who recognize it for their benefit or detriment.

A process of awakening latent sensitivities or the 'spark' of potential greatness, guided by others, to develop the 'Sense of Set' and knowledge of the 'Black Flame'. It is framed as being about understanding 'life' itself, not merely strengthening self-consciousness, which is seen as a 'symptom' rather than a 'cause'.

A project under the Metamind Element to collect and analyze Setians' 'unique, realer-than-real' dream/vision experiences. Its purposes include validating ESP, recording the development of supra-normal faculties, and creating a historical commentary of Initiates' working thoughts.

practical_system.description: The Temple of Set's system, as presented, is an initiatory path focused on 'Xeper' or 'Becoming', which is the conscious evolution of the individual beyond natural limitations. This involves cultivating one's unique will (interpreted as 'Do what thou wilt' in the sense of self-direction), achieving 'true magical being' through transformative magic, and gaining knowledge of the 'Black Flame'. The system encourages deep self-awareness and active participation in magical workings to manifest desired outcomes, viewing the Temple itself as a 'tool' and a 'loving embrace' for this process. It distinguishes itself from other traditions by reframing the core of initiation as understanding 'life' beyond mere self-consciousness, and by providing specific methodologies for tracking and developing supra-normal faculties.
tools: The Temple of Set (as an organizational and philosophical framework)
The Scroll of Set (for communication and discourse)
Jeweled Tablets of Set (core textual teachings like the Crystal Tablet and Ruby Tablet)
Setian medallion (as a symbol of attained grade)
Ritual sword (for symbolic representation of will extension)
The Wewelsburg (as a 'laboratory' or focal point for 'conscious evolution')
Registry of Dreams (ROD) (as a means to collect and analyze supra-normal experiences)
rituals: Initiation processes for attaining higher degrees within the Temple of Set
Magical workings aimed at achieving specific understanding, energizing periods, or summoning 'Powers of Darkness' (e.g., the Wewelsburg Working)
'Casting the blueprint of their will' to set processes in motion without interference
Ritual sword use as a symbolic extension of individual will
Use of specific locations (e.g., Wewelsburg's Hall of the Dead) as foci for conscious evolution

relevant_quotes.text: The Temple of Set is a loving embrace from Set himself. It is the heartbeat of Setian initiation. It is a 'tool' whereby such men, removed from the state of mutant beast, are capable of achieving true magical being through the magical art of transformation.

The formula reads 'Do what thou wilt', not 'Do what you want'. Actively pursuing one's will is by no means easy if done in the highest and true sense of the expression, whether one be Thelemite, Satanist, or Setian.

The Word of the Æon of Set is Xeper, if one may believe the Prince of Darkness. That Word says to Become, to use those factors which comprise Thelema, and to utilize the word of the Age of Satan and Indulgence.

To you I say welcome. The realm that you have entered is like none you have experienced. Please leave your preconceived ideas at the door before entering this sacred place, else they will hinder you. Welcome to the gates of initiation and quests for individual and collective truths. And now let the journey begin.
The actual culprit - the disproportionately 'evolved' intellect - escaped the clear comprehension of both.
The Order of the Trapezoid, whether known by its true name or by countless others, will always exist - not as a visible institution, but as a principle in the intelligent mind.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles from 'The Scroll of Set - February 1983' is highly relevant for understanding the foundational principles, administrative structure, and ongoing magical discourse within the Temple of Set during a critical period. It provides direct insight into the esoteric interpretations of key concepts like Xeper, Thelema, and the Order of the Trapezoid, straight from its prominent figures. Michael A. Aquino's detailed account of the Wewelsburg Working offers a unique, first-hand record of a significant magical operation and its philosophical implications, particularly concerning the nature of 'life' versus 'self-consciousness' in initiatory development. The discussions on comparing Setianism to other occult traditions and the internal projects (ROD, Computers and Magic) highlight the intellectual and practical focus of the organization.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience is existing members and new initiates of the Temple of Set, providing guidance on philosophy, practice, and organizational updates. A secondary audience includes academic researchers and practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism, particularly those interested in modern magical orders, post-LaVeyan Satanism, and the historical development of the Temple of Set's unique doctrines.
